text: My husband & I made reservations for two for an anniversary. When we got to the restaurant they told us the restaurant was sold out to a Xmas party and proceeded to walk us out to their pizza place. They put us at a table in the middle of the doorway. I could not get into my seat it was so tight. I tried to pull the table out . That put my husband way in the middle of the doorway. They did have an open table for 4 but would not make it available to us. We just left the place. Ruined our evening!!!!!!

We enjoyed our Spring Training dinner at Tomaso's very much. the food was excellent and the service was great also, Generous portions and I loved the Parmesan Salad shell it was awesome. We will be back on our next Spring Training trip.
The fried calamari was great but the service and the seafood linguini special and the wedding soup were a 3 stars. We were not impressed at all.
Love this place!!  Food is wonderful,  and good portions.  We always pick this restaurant when we want a nice relaxing dinner.

What a wonderful experience! Gino, our waiter, was extremely helpful and knowledgable about the menu! We were glad to have him as our server. The food was outstanding and our cream puff dessert was a home run! We will be going back soon!!

This place forgot about our table. They ran out of food and picked up frozen broccoli and potatoes to cover it up. 2 hours later we weren't fooled. Merry Christmas!  Side note, overheard cooks talking about a cursed table where tables are frequently forgotten. You are an absolute fool if you ever dine here!!

First time review: GREAT place! Our server was Italian, and the food was true Italian (reminded us of our trip to Italy last year). It is a bit pricey, but the food is definitely worth it!   Second time review: Decent service, although some of our orders took a while to come. Calamari appetizer was large and very good. The beet salad was delicious! Both of our meals were good, but they were a bit too creamy.

Excellent meal tonight at Tomaso's in Phoenix AZ.  Menu contains descriptions of one mouthwatering selection after another. Impeccable service combined with a homey setting. Readily understandable why the restaurant has been around since 1977. What a treat from start to finish. Did I mention the best vodka martini I've had in weeks?

Excellent Italian.  I would strongly suggest Tomaso's to anyone looking for authentic Italian in Phoenix.  This place is in the Biltmore area in the same strip mall (strip mall in Phoenix? Shocking!) as Sportsman and Tarbell's which leads to my only complaint--parking.  There is a free valet (tip them you cheapskates) so that problem is partially mitigated.  This place is a real throw back. The waiters are all pro's and have thick Italian accents.  The garlic butter offered with bread is out of this world so even though it's green and strange looking, enjoy it.  I was craving simple spaghetti and meatballs--it's not on the menu but they'll do it for you if you ask nicely.  Coupled with a few Morettis (decent Italian beer) it was a great experience. One place I recommend with confidence and will return to at the earliest opportunity.

Their customer service is horrible at best Phone call to order flowers the manager knew nothing about the order process on the website, was told that someone would call me back, not! Sent several emails still no response as of yet, 5 days and counting Sad to have made reservations 3 months in advance for an anniversary and have such a bad experience for such a highly rated restaurant. Cancelled the reservation due to lack of service!

The veal marsala lacked any marsala/port flavor.  The veal was presented on top of a gravy mixture that did not add any flavor to the veal.  The veal florentine was slightly better as it was presented with lemon based sauce that did add to veal flavor.  Stay away from the $12 tiramisu.  The 2" x 2" serving size is embarrassing small.  The flavor is excellent but the miniscule portion size simply means our family will stay away from Tomaso's until the portion sizes reflect better value.

The last time I was at Tomaso's was 19 years ago for high school prom.  I've been excited to go for the last year and I was super disappointed. I ordered the King Salmon and it was fishy and overdone. The waiter was snobby when I tried to order a Moscow mule and they didn't have ginger beer.  I also felt pressured to order appetizers and desert when I wasn't hungry enough to want those. Go to North if you're looking for great Italian good and great service.

One of the finest Italian restaurants in Phoenix.  The service is excellent, the atmosphere is classy, and the food is outstanding.  I brought my father here when he was in town, (he's a third generation Italian) and he was also impressed.

Me and my wife had dinner at tomas's this friday night.  My wife found Tomaso's Restaurant  in the internet, and since it was by our hotel, we decided to dine there. To our surprise, the  restaurant had a great atmosphere and really authentic  Italian dishes. Even though we arrived quiet late at the restaurant, the staff made us feel very welcome. The waitress provided us with incredible attention and service, with a super friendly approach. She basically helped us decide what would best please our craving for italian cuisine. We are both looking forward to our next visit to arizona and of course to Tomaso's since its italian dishes as well as  service are exceptional.
Food was good. I had the Gnocchi. Service was excellent. Romantic and warm atmosphere.
What a fantastic place! Food is truly spectacular. Great ambiance, people, setting and service. Veramente ottimo!

Really amazing Italian food. This is one of my must-go-to spots every time I'm in Phoenix. Ambiance, service & location are great. Valet parking out front is convenient.  They always hit the pastas & meat dishes way out of the park!

We started the evening of March 2nd at Franco's.  Our waiter wasn't very friendly to begin with, but then the restaurant lost electricity.  After being told that the kitchen could still function, but never being told that it would actually take orders, we left after 20 minutes of being ignored and headed to Tomaso's.  That was the best decision of the evening.  The service at Tomaso's was excellent.  The wine and food were absolutely delicious.

I'm visiting Arizona from Chino Hills California. We were directed to Tomaso's authentic Italian restaurant. Wow, excellent cuisine. I had the pistachio covered salmon and husband had the filet mignon ravioli. Masoud our waiter represents the epitome of a fine connoisseur. Excellent all around experience.

Standard fare.  I didn't see the costs, so I can't speak to that.  Service was excellent.  Pasta was slightly undercooked, bolognaise was a little bland.  Salad was inedible.  I would come back, but I wouldn't get too excited about it.  If and when I come back, I'll update my take on other dishes.

today's 'special' octopus salad was so bad my chickens won't eat it. i'm going to bed with an upset stomach.   it was served cold with a side of "we don't care about your feedback or how crap our food is"  forget this place. the bartender says tomasso is an asshole to work for anyway. as a final point, they've just undergone '5 days of renovations' but didn't wait for the paint fumes to clear. that's probably why the wine tasted so bad.    this place lacks the class it probably used to have

I've been dining at Tomaso's for many years and have yet to have a bad experience! As a matter of fact, my wife and I have have brought many friendsand family with us to enjoy our favorite Italian restaurant and we have yet to find anyone who found the food or the service to be anything less than spectacular!    If you are looking for exquisite, authentic Italian food with the utmost in service, Tomaso's is the place.   Chuck & Lee

I have been meaning to visit this place for years. I'm not sure why I put it off but eventually I tried it for a business dinner. The service was excellent, food incredible and the wine/cocktails were very complementary. I will be back and I'll be bringing more clients. Stellar experience.

I must give a shout out to this lovely restaurant. I was in Phoenix visiting a friend in the hospital and eating on my own. The hotel food was dismal, didn't want fast food, and everything else was Mexican, burger, or chain.I was craving pasta. Drove a little away from the busy section and saw Tomaso's. I thought it was a mid-range pizza place but was tired of driving around an unfamiliar city in the dark. So I walk in wearing jeans and a T-shirt (after hanging around a hospital for many hours) looking the worse for the wear. A lone oldish woman. It turns out to be a white tablecloth place with a very nicely dressed staff. A waiter greeted me and led me without hesitation to a nice table. Treated me like a valued guest and service was excellent. I had great pasta with prawns and broccolini in a light tomato based broth. Excellent rustic bread, herb butter and a perfect Chianti. I'm so grateful to have found such a respite after a long day. Thank you, Tomaso's. Highly recommend. Glad CPK had no parking!!!!

Fantastic Italian food. Service is personal and friendly. High on the price factor, but it is what it is. Honestly, it's a place to go for specially made authentic Itialn food.  If you want cheap, go to the Olive Garden.

My husband and I had dinner at Thomaso's. We got seated promptly and was given a basket of bread. It was boring, not very tasty bread...but I thought "that's authentic, in Italy the bread is not great either." It came with a flavored butter that was pretty good. The waiter forgot to bring the oil until much later in the meal. The service was good in this place and really fast. I think it was the quickest meal I have ever had. We started out with the calamari. It was very bland and could have used one more minute in the fryer but the marinara sauce that came with it was great! The salad bianco was really good. The dressing was super lemony. I loved it. My main dish was ok. I got the special which was homemade penne ala vodka with langastino shrimp. It was ok. It didn't rock my world. The sauce was a bit bland, the pasta wasn't al dente  but overall the experience was good. My husband loved his linguini with clams!
Excellent food, excellent service. I had their Petra sole and lobster risotto, and arugula, pear, and pecan salad. Delicious. Classy place.

I am baffled by some of the not so stellar reviews that Tomaso's received. Aside from the ambience (love love LOVE that there are no televisions), the service was impeccable. As a first time patron, I had no idea what to expect, and in truth, I have very high expectations (my dad owned upscale Italian restaurants).  Of the five items my husband and I ordered, two were prepared specially for me (oh my, the gnocchi with meat sauce was pure heaven). Our server was knowledgeable, courteous, and funny. We had such a pleasant experience. My only regrets are that I did not ask our server's name and I didn't leave room for dessert!

This place is totally underrated.  I would give this place a 4.5    I come here every time I visit Phoenix for work and it does not disappoint.  I've had their ribeye steak, their osso bucco ravioli, and their cioppino and they are all excellent.  My favorite of the three being the cioppino which I ask for a little spicy, sans the noodles.  A big plate of the seafood & tomato broth and some crusty bread is all I need.  Tomaso is still the head chef of this place and is always trying out new dishes.  The best ones make it onto their printed specials list in their menu.  The last night I ate there, he had just flown in from Italy and still went to work testing dishes.  Lots of respect for hard-workers like that.

We tried Tomaso's for the first time on our Anniversary. Disappointing. For the cost, I expected it to be over the top! The service was great, but the food was nothing to write home about. Won't be going back.

Waited 2 hours for our main course.  Made 7:15 reservations for 4 of us.  Watched several groups who walked in after us get served.  Brought this to the attention of our waiter and hostess but still no food appeared until 9:40.  The restaurant was clearing out by the time we were served.    In the end, they comped our meal and wine brought dessert and a lovely chocolate liquor.  Tomaso came out and apologized at the finish of the evening as he was busy in the kitchen.  We were told we had a new waiter which added to the problems.  Such a disappointment for us locals because this is a great location, nice ambience (although a little too bright in main dining room).   We will stick with L'Amore, Franco's or Christos which offer a similar Menu but much tastier and more organized!!

The Italian Region of Tuscany has given the World one of its greatest cuisines. Whether you consider yourself an aficionado or simply one who loves excellent Italian Food, and you are seeking a very special dining experience, we would like to suggest you treat yourself to an evening at Tomaso's. You will be very glad you did!  Tomaso's on Camelback is beautifully appointed and provides an elegant environment in which to thoroughly enjoy the creations of Chef Tomaso and his Staff. The Restaurant Staff is extremely professional and welcoming, very knowledgeable, and unobtrusively attentive in catering to their guests.    I was a guest of an old friend who had invited me to partner with him in a golf tournament and I wanted to treat him to a special dinner in appreciation. We both happen to share a special affinity for "Pappardelle al Cinghiale" (a Wide Noodle Pasta in a Wild Boar Sauce) that is very difficult to find outside of Tuscany. Just on a whim, I went on Tomaso's Web Site to inquire about the possibility of them making us  "Pappardelle al Cinghiale" one evening - Quite frankly, I didn't expect to even receive an acknowledgement of my inquiry, much less a response and that would be positive - so, what a delightful surprise it was when just a couple of hours later, I received a very warm response from Ms. Rosie Delgado, the Restaurant Manager, saying "Chef Tomaso would be delighted to....!" I was grinning from ear to ear and when I told my friend what was in store for us, he was as every bit as excited as I.  We arrived 15 minutes before our Reservation and when the waiter who greeted our entrance checked the computer, he grinned and said "Ah "Pappardelle al Cinghiale"- my favorite!" and as he led us to our table and seated us, we both were immensely impressed that, not only were we expected but it was known for what we'd come!   Shortly after we were seated and even before we had selected a bottle of Chianti from the extensive Wine List, Chef Tomaso came to greet us and genuinely made us feel special. In addition to the requested Pappardelle, we deferred to Chef Tomaso's recommendations and we were treated to a fabulous meal that consisted of five separate courses -  an Appetizer of molten Mozzarella in a crust of perfectly seasoned bread crumbs, our specially requested  "Pappardelle al Cinghiale" (just like I remembered from Tuscany!), a perfect Lemon Veal Entrata, a delicious Sauvignon Dessert, concluding with a Chocolate Digestivo - each course presented and served elegantly.    Chef Tomaso returned a couple of more times, even sitting with us for a few minutes, checking in on how we were enjoying ourselves and Ms. Delgado did the same. In true European Style, we lingered in very relaxed fashion for over three hours!   Both of us have traveled the world extensively and agreed that nowhere have we experienced a better meal!  In summary.... For Fine Italian Cuisine, an Elegant Environment, Impeccable, Attentive and Accommodating Service, I highly recommend Tomaso's on Camelback.  Buon Appetito!

Just visited Tomaso's for the first time, and regret that I hadn't dined there sooner!  The tiny parking lot has free valet parking which made entry and exit very easy. Yes, my party tipped -it was hot outside!  My party arrived at 5:30, which is early, and there were just a few tables seated. As our meal progressed, the place filled to capacity and we dined on a weeknight.  We were greeted at the door with genuine warmth by several employees and were quickly taken to a table by our server. Our server was very warm, patient and gracious. Other servers kept our drinks filled and plates removed quickly and efficiently. Every need was filled immediately.  The herb butter and fresh bread were perfect. The bread was warm, chewy inside and crispy outside.  The salad with pears and gorgonzola was served in a baked parmesean bowl and featured slices of fresh bartlett pears, gorgonzola cheese, candied nuts and a house made vinaigrette. It was crisp and delicious, with a nice contrast of tart, sweet, nutty and cheesy.  The hazelnut risotto was delicious, as was the past trio. Please note that the pasta and risotto dishes are modest in size, and designed to be one course in a meal. These are not huge heaping plates. They are artful servings of great handcrafted food. Traditionally, one spends a lot of time at an Italian meal, so, courses are reasonably sized.  The pasta trio was just right for my mother who is a senior citizen and eats modest portions. She had a salad and the pasta and was very happy.  The Osso Bucco was delicious! The portion was very large and I wound up sharing partly because it was so good, but, also because it was a big plate of food. It was served in a sauce with chunky vegetables and plated on mushroom risotto.  We enjoyed the house Chianti and it was a perfect complement to the meal. Coffees were fresh and very good. We did not have dessert because we were stuffed!  Overall, this was a very solidly great dining experience; a perfect example of the best Italian fine dining.
Love this place! AMAZING food, so friendly and helpful with lovely, quite ambiance.
Very Italian menu lots of fresh use of seafood.  I had the lamb meatballs and bolonegnese and it was fantastic and hearty. Also Veal Saltambucco and it was also fantastic. Too full for dessert here!

The new Tomasos just opened in our neighborhood off Pinnacle Peak and Scottsdale Rd. We made a reservation and were warmly greeted and promptly seated. Our waiter, Michael, arrived while we were looking over the menu and provided top notch service throughout the meal. Food was fresh and served piping hot which isn't always the case in other restaurants.  We shared the calamari which was tender and crisp along with a divine marinara sauce. My fettuccine con funghi was exceptional as was hubby's lemon veal. Run, don't walk, to dine here !

Tomasos did not dissapoint this NJ native during superbowl weekend.  Their drinks were poured accurately and plentiful.    With regards to the food, the order consisted of the below: BEEF CARPACIO CHOPPED SALAD TARFELLE PASTA AND MEATBALLS (SPLIT INTO TWO ORDERS) VEAL CHOP LAMB CHOPS. ICE CREAM  The two appetizers were both enjoyed and the size was what you would expect. Not large nor small.  The pasta dish was shared and tasted amazing.  My companion had the lamb and he typically gets that at restraunts.  He said the meat was a good cut and cooked perfectly.   I had a veal chop not found on the menu and due to my improvisation no sides are listed.  They decided to give me a gnocchi pasta and potatoes.  I thought the chop was a bit small; however the cut (taking into account fat ratio and placement to the meat) was amazing.  I have to also give credit where credit is due in mentioning it was broiled perfectly as well.  We went to The Missiin, Different Pointe of View, & Tomasos during our stay and I have to say while the others were both great...Tomasos would inch out ahead if I were to make a suggestion to a friend.

Would give 3.5 stars. Food good but not great. Sauce for mussel appetizer was bland. Same with osso bucco & rissoto. Spouse had special: seafood ravioli & orange roughy. Fish nicely prepared but needed more sauce. Didn't care for seafood ravioli or sauce on it. Arugula pear salad was delicious. Ceasar salad was good but had better. Portions for all courses were quite generous with exception of tiramisu desert. Was delicious but very small serving. They do make a great cappicino. Atmosphere nice, service very good. Prices moderately expensive. Don't think we'll go again-better Italian places out there.
Had another exceptional evening at Tomaso's last night. Been here many times. Great quality food, great service. Best Italian food in Phoenix.

I sat at the bar. In the bar area.  Very nice and quiet.  First class all the way. The staff really went out of there way to make me comfortable. The wine list is amazing.  The food. Just the right amount per portions  highly recommend. Any day of the week.

We left still hungry, very sad.   TLDR; not the best, go to Sicilian Butcher instead.   We walked in and was seated promptly. Our server was ok, nothing spectacular. I ordered the clam linguine and my husband got the veal and filet rigatoni. The sauce for the rigatoni tasted canned, we were so disappointed.   At least the Chianti was good!
The food was amazing!!  Service was great.  Atmosphere was a little lacking-several tables nearby talking loudly-not very quiet or relaxing experience.  But the food made up for it!

Poor service, the waiter made me feel like I was stupid every time he came to the table. Food was honestly not my favorite. We tried salad, soup, 2 entrees, and 2 deserts and nothing was worth the high price we paid. There are better places in Phoenix for Italian food.

FANTASTIC!  For Thanksgiving.  Gino was great, made great recommendations and the Tomaso red wine was wonderful.    The clam appetizer was De BOMB according to my teenagers. We had the Italian sampler, Butternut squash and Eggplant  , Chicken Parmesan, Lobster scampi ravioli and Squid Ink pasta with a Special Tomasso prepared desert platter.  A meal to remember!  GRAZZI!  The staff was amazing and attentive.

While the food was good, the service was lacking.  We had a 5:30pm reservation and there were only three other tables with people at that time.  I couldn't tell you the waiter's name because he never told us.  Although he made a recommendation of one of the daily specials, he barely spoke to us and always seemed to be in a hurry to leave our table to do something else.  We actually had to try to find him to order a second round of drinks and dinner and he never once came back to see how we were doing or if our food was ok.  He didn't come back until we were done and the bus boy had cleared our table.  Truly unacceptible.  I will say the meatball appetizers was great!  They clearly do veal well as there were four or five veal options.  I had veal medallions which were one of the daily specials.  They were extremely tender and great taste.  The potatoes and asparagus were so-so.    Normally we order desert, coffee or after dinner drinks, but opted to get the check and go since the service was lousy.    It was also frustrating this parking lot had one handicapped parking spot right in front of the restaurant (family member in wheelchair) and right were the valet parking attendants stand. I asked if I could park there and the attendant told me he would park the car. A little annoying I have to tip someone to move my car five feet.  And a little surprising the two valet attendants stood there chatting while I got the wheelchair out of the trunk.  We valet the car often and most of the time the attendants help me with the chair, especially when we are dressed for dinner at a descent resteraunt.   To sum it up, good food, but with all the options we have in Phoenix now, we won't waste our time going back to Tomaso's ever again.

Best dinner I've had in a long time! I was there with my family and family friends for Mother's Day and Tomaso's had a superb special Mother's Day menu. Our family friends are from Italy and say it is authentic as you can get. The quality of food was excellent, and I was especially impressed by the Petrale sole main dish I ordered. Having worked in the seafood industry, I am a self-proclaimed fish snob, and was blown away by the quality and preparation of this fish dish. Tomaso's gets his seafood from Santa Monica Seafoods, who has a high-level reputation for quality and sustainability.   Wait staff was fun to talk with, some are Italian themselves, and I truly felt like I was back in Italy!

Took my girlfriend here for our anniversary, everything tasted great but I would have to say that the server was a bit rude maybe because we were young but, he gave us a dirty look when we told him we didn't want wine.

Excellent service & amazing food! I contacted Tomaso's a few months ago when I was searching for restaurants to host a surprise birthday dinner at. They have a few private dining rooms which is what I was looking for. Out of all of the 15+ places I contacted, this was the only one that did not have a minimum amount to reserve the room! I was shocked! Especially considering how nice this restaurant is & that smaller places were requiring $800 - $1500 minimum amounts. I worked with a lovely lady named, Vincenza, who responded to me quickly, stayed in touch throughout the weeks leading up to the party & made sure it was everything I wanted & more! All of the staff here are incredibly friendly & personable. Making all the guests laugh & feel comfortable! & of course I have to talk about the food! Amazing, homemade Italian dishes that are to die for! Thank you, Tomaso's & Vincenza for making the night so special & one that we will never forget! I will recommend you to everyone!

This is my favorite place to eat in Arizona and I'm a native. I've been here almost 32 years and I just love coming here.  I came here once with my wife and then several months later with some coworkers. I had the same waiter (great guy with the pony tail) and he remembered what my wife had ordered months back. I couldn't believe it.   The bar is top notch. They make the best Manhattan in the valley.  This is real Italian food folks. Of course there are some negative reviews because well, some people just like The Olive Garden. You can't please everyone. If you like going to The Olive Garden, this place isn't for you. If you like to feel like you just discovered a gem in Sicily for the first time, definitely come to Tomaso's.  It's nice enough to celebrate Valentine's Day or an Anniversary here, but also cool enough to go with a group of guys to get some drinks and eat for a few hours ... Yes, you can literally spend hours here eating and drinking. They always make you feel like family.   Jason

Absolutely LOVE this place! Went for dinner last night with the girlfriend, a friend and her mom. The appetizer we wanted was no longer on the menu, as Tomaso likes to change the menu regularly, but we asked for it anyway and our request was happily granted. We ordered a bottle of Tomaso's own red wine, Luxur 2004, fabulous! Our appetizer was lemon caper shrimp. Filet mignon was perfection, and for dessert we had fudge truffles. I asked for strawberries with the truffles and again, wish granted with zero hesitation. Everything was perfect as always. I wouldn't bring a girl here on a first date cuz it's a bit spendy for a girl that has no guarantee, but the place definitely drops panties.

I'm torn on if this should be a 3 star for me but honestly? I want to be impressed, but I just wasn't. My husband took me her for Valentines Day because the Lon's at the Hermosa (our favorite) was booked. Our waiter wasn't very good although he caught himself it seemed. I just figured he must not have a high respect for women due to his age and accent. Im not going to pick this review all apart but I did like the lady who sold us our bottle of wine and I liked my orange roughie. The balloons on the ceiling looked tacky and would have looked nicer if a curly string was at least attached. It was just a bad valentine decor, bad valet, bad service but great wine. It was my first time and I'm sure my last. I'm really disappointed and wouldn't ever recommend this restaurant.

We have been going to Tomaso's for at least 15 years. ALWAYS a special treat! We go for. 99% of our anniversaries, birthdays, and special evenings out. The staff is very attentive and the food is always amazing! Best seafood in town and the pastas are better! Get a bottle of Monte Olimpo Nero d'Avola or Wedell Pinot Noir, you will love them both!!

I'm so disappointed with the service here. We made a reservation through Yelp for 8pm last night, and when we got there the hostess promptly seated us. However, the room they sat us in was extremely cold, and I'm a baby when it comes to cold, so my boyfriend went back to the hostess to ask if we could get another table. She told him we'd have to wait 10-15 minutes, which we were fine with, so we headed to the bar to sit and wait.  About 30 seconds later, the hostess came back and said she had another table for us. We thought this was awesome since we were expecting to have to wait. What we soon realized is that she just wanted to get us a table quick so she could have better tables for other guests. So she proceeds to walk us to our table... And sits us at literally the worst table in the entire restaurant. It's the kind of table that you wonder why they even bothered to put it there because the location is comically horrible.  To my direct right was the kitchen. I could literally see into the door. And every time a server went in or out all I could hear was the severe loudness of the kitchen.  About 5 feet behind me was the busser station. And if you're unfamiliar with a busser station, it's where the bussers put all the trash and dirty dishes after cleaning their tables.  I can't believe this is where you would seat people in general, let alone people who made a reservation! The pasta dishes are an average of $20 per plate, so there's no way I'm going to pay around $150 for a meal for two people when I can practically reach out and touch the kitchen garbage behind me! We ended up leaving and didn't even order food, and the hostess didn't even say anything to us when she saw us leaving. Talk about a terrible experience and some really bad customer service.  We will not be back.

My fiancee and I ate here last night. We're testing out places for a rehearsal dinner. The parking lot is a bit confusing during dinner since the valet cones off the lot. If you enter from the Camelback side you might have to squeeze through a sign and a cement column to get to valet. The interior of the restaurant is ok, seems a bit dated but not too bad. Our experience seemed to be a bit rushed. It felt like as soon as our plates were cleared then next course was on the table. The bread and I assume pesto butter was delightful. The service was OK  but the waiter seemed to rush us and did not really explain any of the menu or tell us the daily vegetable. We had lobster bisque was decent, not the best I've ever had. The dish was so hot that it burned my tongue. For our main dishes, we had the mixed grill and the ribbon pasta with mushroom and truffle. The mixed grill comes with a link of in house made sausage, lamb chops, and a filet. The portions were decent. The waiter neglected to ask me how I would like my filet when I ordered, so it came out well done and the taste of the beef not pleasurable. The best thing by far of the night was the lamb chop. It was seasoned well and cooked to perfection. The sausage link was so-so. My fiancee's dish was interesting. The mushroom-truffle part was tasty, but the ribbon pasta tasted like something from Hamburger Helper. I know they make it in house, but the pasta was not what I was expecting. For dessert, we tried the pistachio cheese cake and caramel chocolate cake. The dishes were respectable but nothing to elevate it from the crowd.
Food here is so good.   The Atmosphere is just average all white tablecloth and open room.  Can be A little noisy. But food wise it's one of the best Italian places you can find in PHX

When we lived in Paradise Valley we used to go to Tomaso's often but we moved further away and it had been a few years since our last visit.    So happy to be able to say again, Tomaso's remains one of Phoenix's best Italian restaurants.  We went with some friends on Christmas Eve and the service was friendly, attentive...excellent.  The food was as good, if not better than we remembered.  All four of us loved the service, loved the environment and couldn't stop complimenting the food.   By comparison, we had been invited to Christo's Italian restaurant a few months earlier and that dining experience did not remotely compare, in any way, to Tomaso's.    I highly recommend Tomaso's.  We loved it so much...we're going back on New Years Eve.
As good as it gets; superb food, atmosphere, service. Try it during Restaurant Week when you can sample favorites
Food was excellent, service great, good wine list, but way too large a markup on the wine.

The lunch we had at Tomaso's was so amazing that I had to write about it!  This was my first experience at Tomaso's so I did not know what to expect.  I have always heard great things about Tomaso's but had no idea it would be this good!   We started off the meal with a shrimp appetizer - the shrimp was sautéed in a lemon caper butter sauce and tasted so good.   Then we ordered our lunch entree -  rigatoni Amatrciana and veal parmiggiano.  The pasta was cooked to perfection, sauce was amazing and the veal was so tender it practically melted in my mouth.  We even decided to splurge on dessert - a wild berry tart which was light and delicious - perfect with an espresso.  If this is what lunch is like at Tomaso's, I can hardly wait to check it out for dinner!  Definitely my new favorite Italian restaurant!  Tomaso's is perfect for a business lunch and I know it will be the perfect date night dinner spot.  The wait staff in the restaurant was very attentive to our needs and made sure we were well taken care of without being overbearing.   Tomaso even came out and introduced himself and asked how everything was which has never happened to me before. I can't wait to come back - very highly recommended!

I met my sister and her husband there last month for my birthday. The place seemed very nice but unfortunately I had an unrelated medical emergency after just a few bites. The staff got involved and went way above and beyond in order to help. They called the police and tended to me while the ambulance was en route. Can't tell you how great they were, so a big thank you to those involved!  As a follow up I just ordered some takeout and turns out the food is pretty good too! The veal in the large portioned veal parmigiana was unique and tasted great.

Great food and great service. The entire staff was friendly. The food came out fairly quickly especially considering that the restaurant was so busy. Our waiter was very attentive. Luckily, the service does not outshine the taste of the food. I got a pasta with shrimp and lobster and it was absolutely delicious. I loved it. My girlfriend got some sort of eggplant and she said it was really good. My mother in law got the lasagna and it was also super good. We didn't know much about this place but now I know I will recommend it to anyone who visits Phoenix.

I had high hopes for this restaurant as I was directed to it by my friend and fellow Yelper, Donald S., and oh...my...God...was the squash ravioli at Tomasos AWESOME!  It was perfect.  It arrived quickly, was presented well, was a good portion for lunch, and geezuz, the sauce was to die for!  It was a bit expensive for lunch, but those of you who know me, know that I say that at almost every meal.  I'm cheap, what can I say?  Oh, I forgot the bread!  It was perfectly baked and came with the most wonderful herb butter.  For bread lovers, this will be on the top of your list!  I highly recommend this restaurant, and I can't wait to try it for dinner!

I had dinner at Tomaso's the other night, and found it to be a very solid meal. I was able to secure a table without a reservation, though that may be always possible, especially on the weekends.  The wine list is extensive and impressive, including a nice selection of wines by the glass. Unfortunately they do not stock any of the great craft beers coming out of Italy. I started with a Tuscan bean soup that was good, though lacking in anything exciting. For my main, I had a daily special that was a house made swiss chard and kale ravioli stuffed with ricotta cheese, with a balsamic demi-glaze.  Service was attentive, but not smothering. Overall very good dinner.

I recently attended a Winemaker Dinner at Tomaso's featuring Tomaso's wines from Sicily.  The Winemaker Dinner was sold out and all of the guests who attended were very festive and lively.  It felt more like a family gathering than a Winemaker Dinner.  Throughout the evening, guests mingled about the room and it was a very fun and social environment.     The dinner featured strictly Sicilian dishes and was not your typical Italian fare. The menu consisted of stuffed artichokes, gnudi, swordfish roulade, mixed grill and Cassatelle con Ricotta as dessert. According to the Sicilians in the room, the dinner was authentic Sicilian style.  I love dining at Tomaso's and just wanted to spread the good word again. I have attended several of Tomaso's Wine Dinners and the event on June 23, 2012 was one of the best wine dinners Tomaso has put together.  As far as I could tell, everyone at the wine dinner had an amazing time and enjoyed the food immensely.  There were a lot of empty plates going back to the kitchen.  There was plenty of laghter and the atmosphere was jovial. Tomaso even gave a couple of speeches and was very humorous.  As always, Tomaso came through with an amazing Winemaker Dinner that was so much fun.  Bravo to Tomaso's!!!!

We like this place. Because we don't live nearby we dine here once or twice a year.   We enjoyed lunch today. I love the linguine vongole.  We will be back. I was a little frustrated by wine price: we had a nice wine for $49 but I recognized it as a $26 wine at an Italian restaurant near our Oregon home. Of course this was white tablecloths and wonderful service so I suppose  high priced wine supports it
Great place and wonderful food! The waiters are fantastic and the whole setting really gives off an authentic feeling.

This was my absolute first time at Tomaso's. What an experience!  From the moment I walked in I was greeted very pleasantly by the hostess and three staff members.   Staff were extremely knowledgeable of the wines as well as the menu items. Some spoke very heavy Italian...I don't; but it didn't pose a problem. After my arrival, the place filled quickly; ranging from couples to eight member parties. Noise was at a minimal.  I began my dining experience by having a glass of resieling as I admired  the artwork, lighting, furniture, etc. and soaked up my surroundings. I noticed that every occupied table had a bottle of wine on it... except mine.  Meal options: I chose to start with the Fiori di Zucca - stuffed zucchini blossom with organic ricotta, basil & mozzarella. Talk about a treat for your palate! For an entree, I chose the Menage a Trois -  lobster, scallops, and shrimp in a savory fresh tomato sauce, olives & basil; served on linguine. Yum. Yum!  Everything was on point and served in a timely fashion.  I was please with the entire experience. I recommend Tomaso's for special occasions or for those that missing true authentic Italian food.
Finally authentic Sicilian food in Phoenix. Combine it with great service and it is a classic go to restaurant.  If you haven't been to Tomaso's what are you waiting for!

Had an amazing evening and dinner at Tomaso's. Our server Joe made the overall experience so amazing that we can't wait to come back! His recommendations (veal bolognese & seafood tomato dish) were absolutely delicious. It was our two year anniversary and he made made it a point to treat us to a specialty dessert on the house. Service, food, experience, ambiance, and service are all a solid 10/10!! Thanks Joe!!

Food was dynamite, drinks were dynamite, service was dynamite, and the chocolate mousse was dynamite. The whole experience was really a 6 Star review but I can only do up to 5 stars. It truly was an authentic Italian food dining experience. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic Italian experience.

Last minute for lunch, in the area, we were seated immediately. Beautiful establishment. Peaceful, quiet. Not so busy for lunch. Staff seems distant, to be expected, I guess. Today we had Mozzarella Tasting Caprese, artistic presentation, tastes average. The Italian Wedding Soup is disappointing ~ bland & needs more meatballs (I'm really not a big eater either). But I can share with you the "silver lining" to this dreary day: The House Made Sicilian Sausage ~ The most flavorful sausage served with a sauteed mixture of bell peppers, onions & pine nuts all in this wonderful, hearty, robust glaze!!! It's definitely going to be the reason I'll go back - maybe for take out.

Delicious food but rude servers. We didn't like him so we left a tip accordingly. After ten minutes Our server came outside to stop us halfway of the parking lot to tell us we left a bad tip and asked us "was there something wrong about my service?" Ended up telling us he didn't like us. It was as if we had no right to leave the cost of our tip. It's how we felt about the service and I don't think we should be judged for it. But food was good. Just hope you don't have the old Italian man with a pony tail as your server. He may chase you out the door to complain about your tip.

I went to Tomaso's as my 1st Restaurant Week stop. The service was absolutely great! I sat at the bar with a great bartender, Robin. He was knowledgeable and very excited about food, just like me.  When I mentioned I needed to skip dessert, he was happy to substitute and Italian wedding soup! That was very generous! It had no pasta, which is unusual for a wedding soup. Instead, diced white meat chicken took its place next to traditional and delicious little meatballs.  I came specifically for the zucchini blossoms, and they didn't disappoint! Beautiful, tasty, even the stems! Though I think they could have used a bit more salt. And after all that, I forgot to take their photo!  The shrimp on the shrimp and lobster ravioli was amazing!! Very meaty, no fishy flavor whatsoever, and the lemon sauce was perfect! The ravioli had a clear clean lobster flavor and perfect tooth bite.  #eatARW
Always wanted to try the food here since it's come so highly recommended. Did not disappoint.  Felt like being in Italy with the great atmosphere and the staff.  Will go back many times.

Sadly, I did not find this place to be as tasty as I hoped or for the prices either.    However, I thought it was going to be uber good because of menu choices and descriptions...and the prices.  But prices lie sometimes...or a lot!  Oh and perhaps because their pesto butter that they give with their bread basket was yuuuuuuuuuumy!    We went for a friend's birthday dinner and so we shared the fried mozarella balls with anchovy sauce and capers.  Now that was tasty!    I got the filet mignon ravioli with veal demi sauce, aromatic vegetables, truffle, and parmaggiano.  Sigh.  The raviolis were good, but I was expecting parmaggiano melted on top and more of a taste variety.  The first few bites were tasty, but I quickly became bored with it.  I did nosh on my friend's seafood ravioli (which were pretty good since it had a cream sauce) and a bit of another friend's veal.  I've had mouth-watering melt-in-your-mouth veal in Sorrento, Italy...so that is what I was hoping for and expecting.  Not so much. See my attached photo...there certainly isn't much to it, very 2-dimensional.    This one was a definitely let down for sure.  And for the pricetag, I'm not happy to not have enjoyed it more.  There seems to be a very old crowd here as well.    Our server was very friendly and helpful as well.  I was afraid not to finish off my last ravioli though, even though I was full, because he would give us a hard time if we didn't finish things on our plate.  Gotta love Europeans!  I remember that happening often when I traveled all over Europe awhile back.  LOL

Great uncomplicated Italian food.  Reminds you of bit of stepping back in time to the "Rat Pack" era.  I have been able to find some Sicilian dishes here I have not been able to find elsewhere.  Service has always been fantastic and have loved whatever I have ordered.

A few friends joined me at the bar last night and we had a very nice experience.  Tomaso was there but spent most of his time watching over the kitchen and serving staff - as he should.  After 40 years he has opened this second location in North Scottsdale.  While we have a handful of other Italian restaurants in close proximity, I can comfortably predict this will become the local favorite.   A few kinks need to be worked out, but that's perfectly understandable being open for just a few days.  We saw a server move the bowl of grated parmesan cheese from one person that just finished his spaghetti to another that just had some arrive.  That's not like a bottle of ketchup and should not be shared amongst customers.  I know fresh grated parmesan reggiano is expensive and shouldn't be wasted - but the server should sprinkle it on the food for the customer and take it away - unless that customer requests to keep it.   Everyone I spoke to loved their food.  His prices are about 10-20% lower than Spiga, Pane e Vino and Gianfranco's nearby.  The only complaint I hear over & over again was his high prices for cocktails.  My rum & coke cost $11.00.  Only nearby Mastro's charges that high a price, but it's a much more generous pour at Mastro's.  Most other high quality restaurants in the area charge between $7-$8 for the same drink.  Tomaso needs to address this because his 30+ seats at the bar will generate at least 20-25% of his business in this part of town if he does it right. Finally, I noticed a few staffers that came from other restaurants in the area.  The waiter John was with Pane e Vino for 15 years.  I stopped going there a few years ago because of the new owner, but missed having John wait on us.  I was sure glad to see him again.  A true professional!  Good luck Tomaso.  We're glad you're here.

Absolutely delicious! This is not "Americanized Italian" food. The pasta dishes are far from ordinary & full of flavor. The Fava Bean Salad was incredible, it's a seasonal food item, but a must have! The service was great with professional/friendly staff. The restaurant is great for a romantic night out, business dinner, or for casually chilling at the bar. I am bringing my family here the next time they come to visit.

In business for over 30 years, this authentic Italian restaurant is one not to be missed. Linen tables and hometown Italian hospitality fill the restaurant. Oil vinegar and Bread came to the table within 15 seconds of our sitting. Gino, our fabulous waiter made us feel right at home. Get the Caesar salad with a parmesan crusted shell! Delicious. We had spaghetti ala o'glio. Not on the menu, but it's just garlic and oil sautéed over spaghetti. Excellent service, atmosphere and food. Ask for Gino, he's great:)

I visited Tomaso's with my brother and fiance, while my fiance and I were visiting from out of town. We really wanted a nice Italian dinner on our last evening in town, and Tomaso's did not disappoint! It's not the trendy American-Italian (which I actually really enjoy) - its more old-school, white tablecloth style. Both are awesome in their own way!  Our server, Arturo, was amazing. He was really helpful with recommendations and we didn't feel rushed at all. We were probably there for over two hours... which is fine by me when doing this style of dining. Our appetizer, Crudo Carpaccio, was a steal at $12 and a great way to start the meal. We each ordered different items with the Osso Buco being the favorite at the table. It was so flavorful and unbelievably tender.   For dessert we had cannoli, profiteroles, and tiramisu - you can't go wrong with any of them. They were all so good!  If you're looking for a traditional Italian spot, check out Tomaso's! We'll be back!

Tomaso's has just taken the spot of my number one Italian restaurant this side of san francisco. I was lucky to have been taken there by my husband a week or so ago for a date night. Tomaso's was booked solid so I was excited he scored a reservation. We decided to arrive a little early and have a glass of wine at the quaint bar. The list is ample with lots of varietals of wines. The bartender was very friendly and accommodating. At our reservation time we were shown to our table. I was surprised how large the restaurant was when our table was in the 'back' of the restaurant. It just seems smaller from the street! Tomaso's is all class with white linen tables and napkins and squared tables. Our waiter greeted us and shared the nights specials: Cioppino and a Veal Chop served Parmigiana style over pasta. Being from the bay area, winning me over with cioppino can be difficult.. so, in truth, I was skeptical. We started with the Charcuterie Antipasto  plate with various Italian salumi; Italian cheeses; olives and amazing grilled artichoke hearts.Our waiter also brought us a basket of house made warm crusty bread and a garlicky basil butter; this was divine. Despite Tomaso's being full on reservations this particular night we were not rushed while we sipped our Super Tuscan wine and nibbled on the charcuterie. The grilled artichokes are knock your socks off good! Finally, after much deliberation, we decided to order. I had to have the Lobster Bisque that was described as having diced lobster within it.. This bisque is heavenly if you like creamy, hearty soups like me. It was rich and filling and full of lobster. On this particular night a Chicken Parmigiana was being served and as much as I wanted to try the Cioppino, (as it was served next to us and it was amazing looking with what looked like an entire lobster tail !), I went with one of my favorites! My husband ordered my second favorite : Maialino Osso Buco. I can't even begin to describe how amazing both dishes were . My meal was very ample in amount and my husband's shank was so tender it was falling off the bone. We both had leftovers to take home! We were so full we did not have desserts and continued to enjoy this very relaxed and mainly, unrushed romantical night out at Tomaso's. I simply was amazed by how great the service was; how we were never rushed on this very popular night ; how awesome the food was and it's presentation, as well. Tomaso's was all I had hoped for on a night out to celebrate a milestone in our relationship with my now husband and they helped make it perfect! I can't wait to return to savor more Italian food here soon!

EVERYONE GET THE LOBSTER RAVIOLI! Best Italian food I've had in a long time. Even though my mom and I weren't in the proper attire we were treated the same as everyone else. If I ever visit Arizona again, I'll be sure to stop by again!

SUCH a disappointing night. This was a dinner we had long awaited, my grandfather and father flew in from Chicago to celebrate turning 90 and 60, as well as I turned 30. My youngest sister also flew in as a surprise. The dinner started fine and service steadily declined. At one point we didn't see our waiter in over 20 minutes and our food took an hour to come out. These two factors combined really killed the mood at our table, as my grandfather was upset which in turn upset my dad. Additionally, the atmosphere definitely lacks compared to other restaurants of the same price caliber. In all, for the price, mediocre food, and terrible service, I would not return. There are so many other restaurants with fabulous food and service that would have made our celebrations what they should have been.

From the options to taste to service to ambiance, I loved this small Italian restaurant! I had the eggplant and squash ravioli and loved it! They also have a great wine list and some different desserts you do not see at every Italian restaurant. I have only been once when visiting for work, but I would go again the next time I am in town!
Amazing food! They make you feel like your part of the family. The pastas are like your grandparents used to make. Always a stop when visiting Arizona! Such a gem in Phoenix!
Such a great restaurant. Food was beyond amazing. It was nice to meet other Italians and talk about our beautiful county.  Buonissimo! Grazie mille e ci vediamo in Sicilia!

good Italian place... the menu has some unique things and they do a good job... it is pretty expensive but for specials occasions it is good.  Zac is right about the accents... but it adds to the flavor and the pesto butter is pretty good as well...

This is the Mother Ship for Italian restaurants.  I've been dining at Tomaso's for the past 13 years and I always know I can count on perfection.  The restaurant is comfortable, clean and the food outstanding.  The food is authentic Italian and if I could give the quality of each and every meal a higher rating than 5 stars, I would give it a 10!  Their portions are generous and Tomaso oversees each dish that leaves his kitchen.  He is a hands on owner who greets his customers with open arms.  His staff follows his perfection as well.  Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve, Valentine's Day or any day, this restaurant always amazes me with their menu.  There are many choices and they are never boring.  It is truly a favorite of mine.  If you're a sports nut, you will find many familiar faces at this establishment.

Really, really good Italian food and wine.  Can be a bit stuffy of a vibe sometimes, but that is somewhat due to the area they are in.  The butter that comes with the bread is amazing, and then I'd recommend the pasta bolognese that has the mushrooms in it

It is a cute little restaurant, has a nice wine list.  I ordered the Linguine with clam Sauce, and a glass of pino.  Personally i think the food is actually pretty good, nice northern italian.  But the service was just ok.

Arrived earlier than our reservations and were seated by 645, didnt get our food until 830 and our order was screwed up. When we addressed the manager he insulted what we ordered and was incredibly rude. I was this close to calling my local godfather to ask for a favor. Maybe if the food was better I would have even slightly understood, but it was nothing to scream about and we were treated more than poorly. Would give a 0/5 if possible.

If you know real Italian then Tomaso's is where you want to eat. The owner Tomaso himself has created a menu and environment with a real Italian fare. I have been eating here for years and have never left disappointed. Matter of fact I dined their last night and left with a stuffed belly and a sole on my face.   I sat at the bar which had the football game playing. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable of the items only the menu. Tomaso was in the house as well. Always friendly and comes by to greet the patrons. I was given some warm fresh homemade bread with some of Tomasos own brand of fresh olive oil. By the way it is the best. He makes his own olive oil and various types of wines which are presented in a full stocked bar.    What I like most is he offers more then he typical Italian resturant options and seasonal dishes. There is something for all dietary needs. I have some food allergies and this Resturant will customize your order.   There is a small room for private parties that can be closed off to the patrons. Decorate classy with top notch customer service.

A Phoenix landmark and with good reason. From the moment you walk in the door- you're "home". Want something a little different or maybe off the menu? No problem but the menu is filled with a lifetime full of variety.  Our server, Evan, was on top of everything and extremely friendly and entertaining- ask for him. The food? Well- it's perfect. Try the lasagna and change your life :-)  We even had the great man himself stop over to greet us, poured us a drink of his own creation and welcomed my wife and I to our new favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  It's a classic- believe me. Going back? Of course :-)

Great service! Okay food! Had not been there in a while! Either the food used to better I have just become more of a foodie!  Its not that its bad food. Its okay for me. Its is authentic Italian with fresh pastas etc. but my husband makes his own pasta so I am spoiled.

This is one of the best restaurants in Arizona. It's a cozy neighborhood joint with world class food. I've been to Tomaso's numerous times and I always kick myself for not going more often.  Last time I was there I went with my father. And, like always, as I was looking over the menu I couldn't believe how low some of the prices were for the quality of the food I knew they had. We started with the Fillet Mignon Carpaccio, with I could've eaten ten of. We ordered the Osso Bucco for the main course, which was $22. It was out of this world! It literally falls off the bone it's so tender - to the point I was wondering how they got it on the plate without it falling apart.   Everything was wonderful. The only knock I really had was the price of our after dinner Limoncello's. Our Negroni's during the meal were the typical $10 which is perfectly normal. But when we got the 1.25 oz Limoncello's they were $10 a piece as well. A price I was taken back by but perfectly willing to pay for the quality of the meal we had.   I highly suggest you check out this world class gem! Tomaso has been there every time I've dined there, and even though I'm not a regular, he always stops by to talk and ask how things are. A very nice man. This place will continue to be my suggestion for when people ask me where to get good Italian food. It's also one of the best "date night" restaurants I've ever seen - very romantic.

Happened upon this restaurant as we were visiting from out of town. My husband had the grilled filet mignon and said it was one of the best he's ever had. I had the cavatelli with lamb meatballs. It was to die for. There was no fettuccini on the menu but the server had some prepared for the kids. The noodles were so fresh and light. Happy family here!

I have to say I was disappointed.  I was hoping for some fresh, tasty homemade pasta and instead found a menu full of heavy meals (lots of meatballs, lobster and steak).  And it was much more than I was expecting to spend - all together $50+ for a glass of wine, a salad, and pasta.    I should have known when I pulled up to the place, which looked like a closed-up men's club.  I think I was one of the few women in the place and certainly the youngest person in the room.  Most tables seemed full of older couples and older men doing power dinners.  I think I confused the wait staff, walking in by myself (I was in Phoenix on a business trip and craving pasta).  I scanned the menu, hoping for something light and fresh...which was a no go.  I ended up ordering a special, black linguine with seafood.  The linguine itself (and the sauce) was actually pretty tasty.  However the amount of seafood was overwhelming and I had to dig out the pasta.  The salad was okay - a Caesar served in a parmesan shell, which was a nice touch.  Overall,  I would give Tomaso's 2.5 stars.  The service was great (although my waiter seemed unsure what to do with a single woman at his table) but the food was only so-so for the amount of money I spent.  Like I said, disappointing.

Having lived in the Valley for 15 years, we finally made it to Tomaso's, a restaurant I have heard about for years. It was not a special night, just a Saturday date night with my husband. We walked in at 7:30 pm with no reservation. That should have been a sign that we shouldn't eat here.  The food was way over priced, especially for what it was. I had the spaghetti cacio y Pepe and my husband had lemon shrimp. His was delicious, but mine tasted very basic. (Yes, it is an easy dish, but I have had carefully crafted ones at other restaurants and been blown away).   The wine poor was generous. We went with the recommendations of the waiter, but was disappointed when he tried to pass off a stale glass of wine. When I asked him how long the bottle had been open, he made a scene to send over the bartender, tell me it was not stale and pour a new glass 'from the same bottle'... It was a completely different wine they poured us the second time. Tired, I didn't want to make a scene, we accepted it and let it sit on the table.  By the end, we just wanted to leave and our waiter was slow to bring the check. Other tables that he was serving were all eyeing one another as well, looking for sympathy.  It was a sad way to spend $100, I wish we would have gone to North or Hillstone, where the food is always good.

This review has to do with a group function, specifically a holiday party for my company. I have personally planned holiday parties for the past 16 years. I have never been in a situation where my wishes for two drink coupons per guest was not honored. My company has been willing to purchase two alcoholic beverages per person and any other drinks ordered are from a cash bar purchased by the guest. This restaurant had bottles of wine free flowing without a drink coupon. They actually took over how the alcoholic beverages were dispersed. One waiter even told a staff member, "don't worry about it, your company is paying ". Unfortunately, it was a family member not someone that felt like that was a positive thing.  Very poor management of my contract and wishes for 40 people.

Tomaso's is a great old-school, white tablecloth, non-stuffy Italian place. I'm not Italian, but my fiancé and soon to be bro-in-law are, and this is the kind of place that their grandfather would take them to. We were in from Pittsburgh visiting, and wanted to have a nice dinner and bottle (or two) of wine before we left town. Tomaso's didn't disappoint. From the Crudo Carpaccio to the Osso Buco to the Cannolis, tiramisu, etc. the whole meal was absolutely delicious!   Our server, Arturo, was very helpful along the way, and we ended up telling family stories and spent 2+ hours at the restaurant. At no point did we feel rushed to get out of the restaurant. It was a fantastic evening, and we will certainly be back when in town!
Best Italian in Phoenix! A little bit pricy but totally worth it ! Good service ! The chocolate mousse cake is to die for !
Food was decent. Many of us felt like the food looked better than it tasted. Nice atmosphere and wonderful service. Staff was friendly

Perfezione! This little restaurant is the epitome of fine Italian dining!  There's nothing more genuine than Tomaso's. We called this restaurant when they were scheduled to close in a half hour, but when we expressed how excited we were to enjoy a meal there the manager agreed to stay open until we had finished.   Upon arrival the door was held open and we were warmly greeted and seated amongst a few other late night diners who were finishing up. The waiter had just finished rowing his gondola from Venice, his accent thick like a finely formulated Bolognese sauce. He delivered the fine red wine we ordered like a master sommelier and took our requests for appetizers patiently. La vita bella!  After we sampled four of their finest appetizers (which were all prepared to perfection), we decided it was time to move into the main course. There were many different dishes ordered: seafood diablo pasta, grilled fish, steak, lobster tail, shrimp, lamb, sea scallops! Everything was cooked with an excellence that could only be matched by the almighty himself. I enjoyed the Tuscan Mixed Grill, which itself was one of the greatest dishes I've ever had. I did, in the tradition of Italian family-style dining, HAVE to try a little bit of everything though...  Topped off with a little dessert dessert wine, this meal could not have been served or prepared better. Tomaso's is a great place to go if you want to get the best Italian food possible.

The food is good but not great.  I prefer this as a happy hour place and no so much as a dinner place.  The bread is delicious and hot.  The calamari is reliable.  The food in general is reliable but I don't view this as a destination place.

This place is amazing! Went here on Thursday to check out the new summer menu specials and it did not disappoint. We failed to make reservations but were offered a short wait time or the full service bar. Opted for the bar as I couldn't wait to get my mouth on a decent chianti - yum! We enjoyed squid ink seafood pasta, decadent lobster raviolis, and a strawberry cream dessert. Can't wait to be back!

We had an excellent meal at Tomaso's.  Nice atmosphere and pleasant waiter.  We had a "light meal".... Caeser salad followed by pasta (carbonara and special) and great Tuscan wine.   We avoided the valets and found a space in the parking lot.

Eight of us dined at Tomaso's on a Sunday evening in March. Our table was understandably a large one, but soon after we were seated a few other large parties arrived as well.  Our waiter was pleasant but unattentive. He frequently forgot to collect everyone's orders as he went around the table. On more than one occasion, he placed drinks or dishes in front of the wrong person - something you expect at Denny's but not at a restaurant of this caliber. We had to search for him frequently to refill water or iced tea glasses. He failed to deliver promised second glasses of wine to two in our party, but somehow did remember to put them on the bill.  Before the meal started, we had asked for the bill to be split in half, and he gladly agreed. But he delivered a single bill. When we reminded him that we requested two bills, gave us a sour face and took a long time to bring split checks. However, the way he split the checks was incorrect and quite frankly (despite several college degrees at the table) unintelligible.   When we FINALLY got him to come by and explained that the split was done incorrectly, he blamed us, made it seem like we were being unreasonable, and then brought back the check split differently - but still incorrectly.   In the end, although the food was good, we left with a bitter taste about the restaurant. What kind of wait staff makes the customer feel bad about a problem the wait staff has?   The food was good, but none of us will subject ourselves to this terrible service again.

We've been dining at Tomaso's before we even officially moved to this area five years ago. Over the years, they have never disappointed. They go above and beyond to make us feel special. They are one of the few places in town willing to cater to you, even creating special dishes. I want give a huge thank you to the kitchen, Robin and entire staff for going above and beyond on our to go order Tuesday evening. They specially made several dishes for us. They even made my favorite gnocchi, which I hadn't had in a couple years. Spinach ricotta stuffed gnocchi in a Truffle pistachio sauce, I could eat that dish everyday. The veal chop was excellent, as well as the Veal Parm. The trio of ravioli and lobster ravioli were outstanding. We really enjoyed the delicious surf and turf creation. Desserts were excellent as always. Thank you so much, we absolutely adore this place!!!

Went there last night for Valentine's Day.  I am thinking the tip off to it not being good is the fact we could get reservations when I called the evening prior.   I asked for a 6:30 reservation, and I was given the options of 6:15 or 6:45.   I picked the 6:45, got there early, and we didn't have to wait.  In fact, there were empty tables. ...  Oscar was our server.   Nice guy.  Professional.  The thing I saw that was a bit disturbing is the fact that when he opened a bottle of wine at a table close to us, the top of the foil fell to the floor.   He kicked it under the table.   Huhhh??  Is that what servers do?    Also, another table next to us had a folded napkin under one of the legs.   I would imagine to keep it from wobbling.  I would think, if they are going to do that how about a less conspicuous color since it readily stood out.  On to my meal.   I ordered the house salad.   I was thinking I should have ordered the dressing on the side.   I mean, it wasn't bad but there was so much that it made me cough -- maybe cause of the vinegar? -- and was completely saturated!  I think I was having salad in my dressing. ...   My table mate had the caesar's salad.   I am thinking I should have ordered that.  I ordered their Silver Oak cab, which is a 2013.   Not a bad bottle of wine.   I looked it up at Total Wine to see what the markup is.  Not bad.  A nice heavy body wine.  We perused the menu.   He decided to get the RIGATONI WITH VEAL & FILET MIGNON BOLOGNESE and I got their special, which I think is similar to the LINGUINE AMALFITANI.   It had all kinds of shell fish: shrimp, lobster, clams, mussels.  I can't remember what else.  I tasted his.   He didn't particularly care for it and neither did I.   It sort of looked like a bad version of spaghetti with meat sauce, and the taste was, well, interesting. ...   I thought not at all palatable.   And I mean it.  My dish, I think had the same sauce.   I concentrated on eating the shell fish.  The shrimp was tough as was the lobster.  Cooked a bit too long??  Thankfully, it didn't have much of the sauce.  He is Sicilian; therefore, I asked if he would return.   He said no.  He would like to give them the benefit of the doubt and say maybe they were busier than normal cause of it being Valentine's Day.   Uhmmmm.   No.

Holy amazingness!!!!!! If I lived in the area, this would be my favorite spot!!! I can't tell you what dish I enjoyed the most: the ravioli was to die for, the lobster risotto was the best I've ever had, and the steak, lamb, and sausage main course nearly had me in tears for savoring every bite. If you are ever in Phoenix you must check out this landmark restaurant! My pops could not rave enough about his gluten-free pasta!! Thanks Tomaso for foodie's dream night of eating!!!

Absolutely phenomenal meal. The salad was crisp and fresh and the dressing was flavorful. And it was dressed appropriately. Some places only put a few squirts but this was on all parts of the salad. I wanted to sip it up with the bread. The pasta course also had a delicious sauce, pasta a nice al dente with gave beans, artichokes and fresh peas. Moving on to the entree another delicious offering. The eggplant piled with ricotta and a marina with 3 delicious homemade butternut squash. Just the right amount of heat to balance the eggplant. The desert was two HUGE strawberries with a dollop of marscapone and a sprinkling of white and milk chocolate what tasted like a small malted milk ball. The waitstaff was attentive and kept all the glasses filled, the room temp comfortable, and the food delivered timely. Tomaso's has been here for years and the only thing that is hard is on a busy night if you don't valet parking lot is super small. But I would walk blocks to come here again!

We were looking for some good Italian food, so we decided to visit Tomaso's. The entire experience was unsatisfactory. You have to park in an awkward lot arranged so that you have to turn out and then back in before you find the Valet. Our waiter vacillated between hovering at the hostess station while staring at us to ignoring us completely. The salad turned out to be canned pears atop wilted lettuce with an odd topping of fried onion strings. The pasta was good, but not worth the $20 asking price. The dessert and coffee were served with no spoons, so we were forced to go foraging for extra silverware at a neighboring empty table. Finally, we had to wait at least five minutes at the valet station for the attendant to arrive back from his break.   On a Saturday night the restaurant was more than half empty, so the waiter really had no excuse. Luckily, his counterpart who was serving the next table over took pity on us and refilled our bread basket and water glasses, offered us fresh ground pepper for our appetizer, and  answered our questions about the dishes our own waiter had abruptly plunked down in front of us before bolting back to the hostess station.   While the experience here gave us a lot to laugh about, we will not be returning to Tomaso's.
Mangia! Most excellent Italian food!  Enjoy a leisurely evening dining at Tomaso.  And try their wine - the one from his vineyard in Italy - amazingly fine.

We found this place by searching online for good Italian food in Phoenix. It seems more upscale than it is. You don't have to be super dressed up to come here, but I wouldn't recommend walking in with flip flops and a tank top.  Everything that I tried here was amazing. Even starting with the bread with the herb butter. I could not stop eating it!! It was so good, and the bread stayed warm the entire time we sat there. I order the short rib with the mushroom risotto, while my aunt ordered the caesar and the lasagna. My 7 year old cousin ordered spaghetti and meatballs because well she's 7. Everything we had was so flavorful. The caesar salad is made with the a parmesan shell, so you get that nice bite of crisp cheese.  The short rib was fork tender, there was no need for any knives at this table. The lasagna....OMG perfect mix of tomato, cheese, and meat. This is probably the first time that I can remember in a long time that I didn't need to add salt and pepper to a dish. It was perfectly seasoned from the first bite. The hardest thing I would say here is to decide what you want to eat because everything looks good.   Of course, we had to do a dessert so I had a cannoli, while they shared a bombolini (?) . Whatever they had was great, but it didn't hold a candle to my cannoli with espresso.   I can't leave this review without mentioning that the service from start to finish was amazing. They were very kind, welcoming, and informative. I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in Phoenix.

Here for Valentine's Day dinner, the place was packed. Had a short wait at the bar, they mix a mean Manhattan (with Maker's Mark as the well bourbon). Got seated, wait staff was attentive and professional. Courses were paced perfectly. Had the stuffed clams, 2 large shells perfectly prepared. Lobster bisque with nice chunks of lobstery goodness. Shrimp-lobster-langostino fra diavolo in a tomato-seafood stock base over perfectly al dente linguini. Had a bite or two of my dates pear salad, that was awesome, too. This place isn't cheap, but the experience and food are well worth it. I wish more restaurants around the Valley had their commitment to the service side of dining.....

Great location for large groups. We had The Sicilian dinner and it was amazing from start to finish. Great service and Great food! I will always recommend it to anyone with a large group or romantic night out!

We just went to Tomaso's on Valentine's Day and I will tell you their food there is to die for! I had the scallops and lobster pasta with red sauce and it was delicious. I had not had lobster that I have liked since we went on our trip to the Breakers and that was a 5 star restaurant and you are walking away with a $600 bill. Tomaso's was very reasonably priced and their food was 5 stars! I will definitely be back

The only good thing about this restaurant is their delicious herb infused butter.  Where to start...I absolutely detest restaurants that do not keep online menus current.  We sat and the menu was nothing compared to what was online.  The service was okay...our waiter tried...but honestly we had to crumb our own table etc.  the staff never removed plates or utensils from courses etc.  It was like stepping into a Service Bermuda Triangle.  I saw the older couple next to us was treated normally.  Which is odd...my wife and I do not look poor...at all.  So it's not an age vs wealth discrimination as mentioned in other reviews.  I think they depend on "regulars" who they cater to.  The crowd was geriatric.  We really wanted to leave but the waiter convinced us to stay.  Despite ordering surf and turf with no breading or cheese due to voiced dietary restrictions we were served battered & fried lobster as a substitute.  The lamb osso buco was inedible...which I ordered due to recommendation.  The caprese salad was served sans balsamic vinegar.  Homemade pasta was also really not good.  My wife had to cut her steak with a butter knife because no one brought a steak knife.  On top of that the restaurant was half empty.  I'm sorry this place just has absolutely nothing going for it.  By the looks of the crowd, menu, food and service, this is where people and cuisine go to die.
Great food ... upscale experience! We were here for lunch, and I was happy to find vegetarian options on the menu. The service was good too! Definitely going back.

Great Restaurant with true homemade pasta and a great owner in Thomoso!  I had the pleasure of eating here last week while in Phoenix.  I had a wonderful wild mushroom Ragu with fresh fettuccini.  I also tried their salmon special, which was solid.  Just a light butter sauce, not over done.    I really had a nice experience here.  I will be back on my next visit to the area.

My boyfriend happened to extend his layover in Phoenix overnight and we were hungry from traveling from Oakland that afternoon. We wanted something good to eat and fast food was not going to cut it.  On his first visit here he met a guy who recommended a few places to eat and this was one of them. Wow, great food.  We were under dressed and looking haggard, so we ordered takeout. We had some sides, I know broccoli was one of them for sure and bread was included with the meal. I had the best veal ravioli in a delicious, tasty sauce. Very light, with tomatoes, sage, garlic, onions and possibly veal broth and olive oil and butter. My cleaned off my plate. My bf ordered fettuccine with grilled chicken. Serving size on that was amazing, he didn't finish it all that night, and guess what I had for lunch and dinner the next day, so good even reheated. I would have loved to go again and try the beef carpaccio. Highly recommend it!

Arrived around 8pm Oct 9 . There was no one at the hostess stand, waited a couple of  minutes until someone noticed us. Our server asked for our drink order and I asked for a taste of a couple wines so that we could decide which to order.  He asked two times 'so you want this one', no we we would like a taste to decide. he seemed very reluctant to follow through. We were planning to order a bottle, instead we ordered  2 glasses. We had carpaccio, nothing special.  For entrees we both had halibut and lobster ravioli.  My fish was dry, his moist. The ravioli was good but could have more lobster,  only a couple pieces the rest was filler.   Kept looking for our server abd didn't see him. Finally someone noticed that we were trying to get their attention. He said that the original server had left.  Would have been nice to know. Probably won't return.

The best thing about this place is the authenticity of the menu and service.  Our server made some amazing recommendations from the stuffed squash blossoms to the cream puffs for dessert.
