I had the Osso Buco di Maialino and it was great. I didn't even need a knife because it was melting off the bone.  My partner had the seafood pasta special and it was a bit disappointing. The lobster was overcooked and so was the majority of other shellfish on the plate. The sauce was really good but the other stuff was just meh.  I would definitely love to try it out again. The spaghetti with meatballs looked awesome.

Came last night for the first time. Beware that parking at tomaso's can be a bit tough with tarbell's sharing the same lot. It wasn't bad with valet, just had to wait in a line 10 minutes.   Got immediately seated and given water and our server came by a couple times so we ordered our drinks but it took a little bit of time to figure out what we wanted to eat - anyway, server sort of disappeared... First before we ordered, then our food took forever! Like it was over an hour after we came in that we finally ate what we ordered. We did get some bread though, so that helped.   Our server was weird, one girl in our party said she wasn't sure what type of wine to get and he just said ok and walked away, no help. She also was still eating bread with delicious pasta sauce and he tried to take her plate away.   The food was really good, I got the ravioli pasta combo and it tasted great, small portion but I wasn't necessarily expecting Olive Garden. And I sort of feel like if we knew what to order at the start, the food and everything would've been faster but I don't know, four stars because the service just didn't really try and it took so long and I was so hungry!

We went to Tomaso's last week for a special meal for my daughter who was starting cancer treatment. They treated her like royalty and we had a delicious meal. Tomaso himself cooked her favorite pasta and gave us delicious strawberries with cannoli cream for dessert. It was an awesome experience and the entire staff went out of their way to make our dining experience memorable and fantastic.

Not anniversary friendly  Food was good was expecting for it to be outrageously delicious when to celebrate an anniversary for some friends when making the reservations I mentioned it was an anniversary thay never mentioned anniversary to them or brought them and anniversary cake. We did get dessert the tiramisú is freshly made every day everything else is store bought so I highly recommend the tiramisu good

Yesterday was my birthday and ended up getting out of work late so we called Tomaso's to see if they could seat us because they closed at 10 and we would get there at 9:20. They politely told us to come on by. The host was so friendly and had the best sense of humor. He joked around with us but remained professional. Our server was awesome. He was friendly and didn't seem agitated that we got there later than we would have liked to. He served us in a timely manner and gave us just the right amount of space. I had the chicken parmigiana. It was the best I have ever had. Toward the end of the night they were cleaning off tables for closing but they assured us to take our time and that there was no rush. I really appreciated that. My dining buddy had to use the rest room so I waited and spoke to the bartender who recommended dishes to try the next time we came in. It was an all-around awesome experience and the staff was not only friendly and personable but they made us feel at ease even though I felt so bad about coming in close to their closing time. I would recommend them to all my friends.

Tomaso Maggiore, Has run Tomaso's for 35 years, since 1977,  this well know (voted best Italian Phoenix yearly) restaurant on the Camelback corridor has the goods.  You can find great Tuscan or Sicilian wines. The food is fantastic. During our meal this evening with a AZ Restaurant week pri fix menu we had the Burrata & Dates as well as the Pasta Pillows drown in a sage butter sauce. For the Entrée we had the Sweet potato gnocchi and stuffed veal. Dessert we had the tiramisu and chocolate crunch cake. The food was perfectly cooked. Often gnocchi can be over cooked, gluten chewy. Ours was perfect.  The veal was stuffed with cheese, accompanied with a mushroom demi glaze which was so awesome.  All was delicious! Our bottle of wine with dinner was the Super Sicilian Luxus 5. Tomaso, On one of his many trips to Sicily, he met by chance Giovanni Maggio, who shared the same dream. In 1994 in Agrigento Sicily, a vineyard of 150 acres was born featuring wines with the bold, natural flavors of the land, and a complexity that ensured its success. Maggiore's Luxus 5 Meritage is a blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Nero D'avola, 13% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot and 7% Syrah.  A dry, medium intensity. The flavors are quite complex and include red cherries, red plums, vanilla, black pepper, clove and liquorice. The service was great, it pays to have employees with longevity who are dedicated to the task. Here are some facts from Tomaso's web site that makes you appreciate him even more: Tomaso's opened its doors on September 10, 1977 at 3:59PM Tomaso's has served over 10 million locals & visitors over the past 35 years Hundreds of thousands of Arizona residents have celebrated their birthdays, anniversaries, first dates and even weddings at Tomaso's. Tomaso's has supported 100s of local non-profits, schools and charities. Year after year, Tomaso's has been voted the Best Italian Restaurant in Arizona. Over the past 35 years, Tomaso's has provided employment for 1000s of Arizonans.  Many of our past team members have gone on to become successful  restauranteurs, lawyers, doctors, business and community leaders. At Tomaso's, the best is yet to come!

From the service to the atmosphere to the food, this restaurant will make you feel like you are eating at a small cafe in Italy.  Just an overall amazing experience.  Food = 5* Atmosphere = 5* Service = 5*

Went on Wednesday place is nice service was good but didn't feel like we got good value for what we paid.  Can't give 3.5 stars definitely not 4 so have to give 3.  Will try again and when I'm off lent.  I had a seafood pasta dish the server recommended.

Started out with the bread which was very good. The calamari was good for our appetizer. Main course was chicken parm and seafood / pasta dish. Food was good and service was not good, not near enough staff for the amount of tables, our waiter was very busy the entire time doing his best. This is where I have a value problem, I don't mind the big ticket, but I had better get the whole package and Tomaso's disappointed us.

A rehearsal dinner I went to was hosted here this past weekend - I have to say overall I was impressed with the place. Italian food in the middle of the desert seemed like a questionable choice to me, but I remained with an open mind, open and mostly dehydrated...  The party of 30(+/-?) arrived with a fairly good clip, there were a few stragglers, and a few people who were there before the main group of us. We were all graciously welcomed and directed to the back/function room.   The waiters were (THANKFULLY) quick to replenish all of our water glasses as soon as we emptied them, and since we are from a way different climate, we went through a TON of water even before everybody else had arrived.   I had forgotten to mention in my rsvp that I had a nut allergy, and when I looked at the place setting and noted the included menu had an almond dessert the waiter was very good to work with me and get me something that I could eat - three flavors of gelato, very tasty.   The pasta dish was fusilli carbonara, which is one of my favorite dishes (to make at home, and to order) and they did pretty well with it, I have to say, I've seen some places mess it up royally, but this had a good balance and when I got some extra grated cheese from our waiter, it gave it a little bit more of a "bite" or "kick" that it was looking for to really fill out the flavor. If it had been homemade fusilli, Tomaso would have won my heart!  There was some confusion or miscommunication between the waiters, us about wither or not wine was *part* of the meal, or if it was by the glass, and added to a tab for our table. Regardless, it was good wine, and I'm glad I had it for my meal, it was a small price (confusion, and in dollars) to have a nice glass of wine to compliment my chicken, and everybody else's steak.   The service was excellent, they catered to our every need, and assisted even the more bizarre requests. The one thing that could make this private function room THAT much more functional, in my mind is a bathroom that is closer than the polar opposite side of the restaurant.   If I ever find myself back in this part of the world, I'll try to make it back and try some of their other dishes - and hopefully be better prepared for the heat!

This Italian restaurant was pleasant, and fairly decent by Arizona standards. The Pasta was properly cooked and the portions of meat and pasta were average. I've had far worse in this state. We ate here in 2014.   I've eaten at a number of Italian restaurants in the Phoenix Metro area, but have decided not to anymore. I grew up in the New York/New Jersey Metro area, and the quality of Italian restaurants in that part of the country, whether a famous  place or a ma and pa hole in the wall, is absolutely outstanding. Arizona has quite a number of Italian eateries that impress people here, but to me, given where I grew up, it's just a disappointment. I love Arizona for a vast number of reasons, but Italian food is not one of them.   I suppose this statement may anger some people in Scottsdale, the West's most Eastern town, but it stands. I have had outstanding Italian food in the Phoenix metro area, but home cooked in people's homes, none of them chefs, and not all of them Italian.

Last night had dinner at Tomaso's.  Waiter was quite good, the braised short rib adequate-overly salty the accompanying gnochi very tasty, but the off menu special of butterflied shrimp and risotto with logostinos  was superb.  The MAJOR disappoint was the drinks.  I ordered vodka on the rocks with onions. I have had stronger water.  The vodka was clearly watered down.  In fact the only taste came from the 3 onions.  AND it was expensive.  Went to Tomaso's after seeing the chef on a local tv station. The restaurant was founded in 1977.  Being in business almost 39 years indicates acceptance by the going out to eat crowd.    Today I was told Tomaso's is known for watering the alcohol depending upon the owner's then mood.  Order wine can't water it down.  Go for the food not the bar you should be ok.

Didn't expect much here upon arrival to the strip mall it is located in but was pleasantly surprised.   Decided to go for Italian food rather than go to the trendy Tarbell's  located in the same strip mall. As opposed to other reviewers,  I simple just parked in the half empty lot in front of the place, no problems.  Valet was available but not required.  The place was empty but the reception was friendly and the service was good to excellent.  Friendly Italian waiter told me it was the slowest week of the year traditionally here.   The wine list was more than adequate but the Italian selections were pricey, I found some better deals on the US selections.   The food was also good to excellent with excellent pastas and fish available, I had the cioppino (I know cioppino and this was 4 star). Salad and vegetable sides were done very well. It is a little old school, kind of reminded me of a suburban Italian Durant's.

Absolutely our favorite Italian restaurant in the valley.  Been here well over 50 times and I can honestly say the food is always outstanding and the service is unmatched. They will accommodate any dish you ask for without the slight hesitation. I enjoy my conversations with Tomaso when I visit.  Superb!

This is a staple of anyone who appreciates the culinary offerings in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. Open since 1977, this fine establishment exudes class, quality, and more than anything else, exceptional, heart-warming Italian food.   Enjoy a bottle of wine or two on a romantic date night, casual dinner with friends, or a sturdy drink when you post up at the bar.   The food is phenomenal and I cannot recommend this place highly enough. Truly a must on any foodie's list of restaurants in the area!
I went there for a friends Bday and it did not disappoint.  Our waiter lived in Italy for 10 years and was a great server.  The pasta is very good and the drinks are strong, I recommend both.

I had a very enjoyable working lunch here yesterday.  I've dined here a few times before for dinner and experienced very good food and excellent service, and this first time lunch experience was no different.  We arrived to a very quiet dining room at 1pm, and were greeted with a welcoming, efficient air by the sole server.  Chairs pulled out, napkins placed on laps, ice cold filtered water served immediately with a plate of lemons without asking.  The bread was crusty, fresh, and served with some sort of delicious compound butter full of galic and herbs. I opted for a chicken caesar, which was served in a handmade parmesan-cheese basket.  They dressed up the chicken breast with a nice light crust of herbs and bread crumbs, and presented the juicy slices over a bed of crisp romaine (which had been dried thoroughly prior to being dressed-- I HATE wet salad leaves!).  The dressing could have had a bit more bite to it , like a good blast of fresh anchovies, but overall a caesar I would order again. The other guests in our party all opted for the rolled ricotta and eggplant special, which was accompanied by large butternut squash ravioli in a light creamy sauce.  Although I didn't try this dish, the crowd cheered and cleaned their plates. The food is quite good, but what really stands out in my mind is the excellent, but not overbearing, service.  Next time I go I will be sure to get this server's name so I may give him proper kudos!

Dingy dining room poor rushed sevrice. Lobster bisque not fresh at all. Chopped salad was all wilted as if it had been plated hours ago and then dressed. All the veggies were wilted. Chicken dish was rubbery served with overcooked broccoli and 2 dull potato wedges. Quite pricey at $24 for a 6-7 ounce  chix breast. Even the bread was subpar It was  torn pieces of ital bread not terribly fresh. Being used to superior italian food in NYC and LA, this place will never see me again

Lovely dinner! We all had some variation of seafood that was heavenly. We were in the back room which was nice and we could converse without screaming. Service was a tad slow but it was Saturday nite and very busy. The food was the star with two of us having the halibut,scallop, and risotto special. Nero d'Avola wine was good accompaniment. Finished with the chocolate mousse and cannoli. A Phoenix classic!

Tomaso's is classic (northern) Italian in an old country setting, straight up. I was concerned after hanging around Little Italy for a month that Arizona's fare would not measure up. I was wrong.  Granted, we did not have the standard experience as we came on Christmas Eve, but the staff was friendly and warm. As we watched food being served, it seemed the same dishes kept coming up over and over again, which is good since our rookie order overlapped:  - Tuscan Legume Soup ($8): Enjoyable but otherwise unremarkable. - Mozzarella Caprese ($13): Sized for two and executed excellently. - Fish Roulade ($29): Special of the evening was fish rolled with crab and lobster meat over spinach with lobster ravioli. How can one go wrong? One can't. - Scampi Caprese & Lobster Ravioli ($28): I'd call this a miss but I'm in the minority as my parents both enjoyed it and most of the restaurant seemed to agree. - The Best Lasagna Ever ($24): A bold claim, but this really was the best lasagna I've had in a very long time - balanced flavors and not too heavy.  For dessert, an adequate tiramisu was heavily overshadowed in both size and preference by a monster cannoli.   Tomaso's is a little on the expensive side but one is clearly paying for quality of atmosphere, service and food. It meets the difficult bar of somewhere on which both my meat and potatoes parents and I can agree. For a special occasion (or on an expense account) I'd definitely drop in again.

Good but not mind blowing good!  Our waiter was very attentive. Always checked on us and made good recommendations. Service = 5 stars!  As for the food, it was a mixed feeling for us. It was good and decent. The complimentary bread and herb butter was delicious. We had also ordered the lobster bisque as well. Good but my bf wasn't too into it!! Calamari were cooked well but we felt the sauce could use a touch more seasoning. My dish, the Amazing Spinach blah blah blah (long name; essentially spinach pasta and braised short ribs) was okay. My pasta was not cooked evenly, some I felt was still under. I was hoping to be wowed since I've heard so much about their freshly made pasta. Maybe I went in with too high of expectation?! The price + my dish yields them 3 stars from me.

We came here for a business dinner. Parking was a nightmare, as the lot was very crowded and the line of cars for valet made it hard to actually maneuver around. We ended up parking in a lot around the corner, behind the restaurant, and it was a very short walk to the front entrance.   The interior is cozy, with tasteful decor. Our dinner had some preset options, including a salad, your choice of entree, and dessert. I opted for a prawn dish. The presentation was well done, the prawns were excellently cooked, with a very delicate flavor.   Service was very attentive and drinks were refilled as needed.   Despite the parking hassle, this is a great place for a nice night out and I'll definitely be coming back if I'm in the mood for upscale Italian cuisine.

Hands down best Italian food in Phoenix/Scottsdale! Authentic, great quality food. The service is top notch. Many of the wait staff are Italian and have an accent which is nice because it gives the feeling of a truly authentic experience. The gnocchi is unbelievable as well as the veal and chicken. I've never had a bad meal here!

First visit here with an Open Table reso for 5:15 PM on the Friday of Valentines weekend (Had ballet tickets for 7:30). We were disappointed with the choice made by the hostess to seat us at the last two top by the rear door. Worst table in the resto. We were entertained by the staff hanging in the service alcove by our table grumbling lol. Our waiter was clearly not their best. We observed other waiters who were polished pro's and wished we were enjoying their service. Cocktails were generous, wines by the glass, so so.  The Capresi appetizer is terrific with Heirloom Tomatoes that were very tasty. I had the veal chop saltimboca and it was terrific, if too much food. My partner had the lobster and seafood pasta and it was very very good. All in all I would say there are other choices that I would make before a return visit, and if I return I will insist on a central table and a better waiter.
NEW location on Scottsdale road is OUTSTANDING and welcomed addition to the area!

Amazing food.  Three of us went there for a celebration.  They did not have the mouth watering filet mignon on the menu but they were willing to give us anything we wanted.  So I ordered a medley to different things so I could try out different menu items.  The salad was very good with the pistachos.  The bread and butter was even a wow factor.  The place was very nicely lit and amazing wait staff.  Geno waited on us amazing they way he spoke to us, he treated us like royalty.  The tables had white linen cloths on them, very upscale establishment and not at all noisy you were able to have a conversation without yelling.  We ordered the wild caught pistachio salmon which was very good, the seafood pasta with sea bass amazing and the trio of fist size raviolli's  The butternut squash homemade raviolli was amazing.  Very nice atmosphere, great wait staff, nice ambience everything you would want in a upscale restaurant.  Plus the melt in your mouth Filet is always an added advantage!!! Yum Yum Good!!!!

I think there's something to be said about going to a restaurant twice during our visit to Az. The food is amazing. The ossobucco is succulent and delicious. The cioppino was crazy wonderful. The staff is super friendly and my hubs loved the wine list. Tomaso's provide a wonderful dining experience. Believe me, the quality and taste of their food is something I won't forget.

70$ for the two off us that included eggplant and gnocci that tasted like the olive garden.  My wife said her meal was good, but I was seriously disappointed.  If I'm paying 25$ for a plate of pasta, you better give me food orgasms.  Well, olive garden tasting food was far from it, plus the parking situation is a joke.

I love Italian food! This [fancy] place deserves a good review for food and wine and ambiance. I can't argue! I was here for a company's dinner, the wines were excellent. Food was good but not "wow". Perhaps, it's not fair since I didn't pay for dinner. I would like to try this out on a more casual date...and freely rating this place. One thing was cool that the owner had his own wine labeled. Some free sample...then a bottle later between three of us - it was good! Cheers!

This was our first visit.  Being that our visit was on V-day the menu was a special holiday menu and the items I had read about on Yelp were not all included.  We were walked through the entire restaurant into their sister restaurant. We were told there were so many reservations they had to open up the other restaurant. They sat our party of 4 at a small hi top bar table. They said that's all they had.  During our entire meal they kept trying to sit people at these hi tops and people kept complaining.    Our service was good and the food was good.  We had the linguini seafood which was good, but lacked that flavor.  Another person had the filet ravioli. It tasted like a meat sauce on top of the ravioli, but was good. The two others had the eggplant. My wife liked it and thought it was delicious.    Overall I would say good food, but I would probably not make a trip from Gilbert again.

Dined at Tomaso's with a group of 12 last Friday evening while enjoying the Labor Day weekend at the Bilmore. We chose Tomaso's due the the Yelp reviews and proximity to the hotel.  Although our waiter was not Italian (I believe he was South American), he was pretty good.  I think he tried to give our large group time to chat so it was nice not to be rushed (which seemed very European).  The meals served were beautiful, but I don't think any of us thought the food was that amazing (we also ate at the Capital Grille and Frank & Albert's-see those reviews-and really enjoyed the food).  I thought the restaurant had priced its menu well for the ambiance and plates served.  I would not be opposed to returning, but there are other better options in the area.

Dined here on Friday June 9th. Had made reservations, but no need as the restaurant wasn't busy. Many empty tables! A shame!  Started with drinks & ordered the Friend Calamari. They also offered a special which was an artichoke w/ zucchini flower. We ordered that as well but unfortunately they were out of artichokes. Ended up getting that special minus the choke with a few extra zucchini flowers. Those zucchini flowers were amazing, stuffed with mozzarella cheese & deep fried. Calamari was standard.  Caesar salad nice presentation, served in a Parmesan cheese bowl, no croutons. Again, standard in taste! I had the ravioli trio: which was an evening special. Three different samples of three types of raviolis. A tortellini in a butter sauce, a mushroom truffle w/ truffle oil , & a pear pecorino. This pear pecorino was heavenly! My husband has the seafood pasta with squid ink pasta. He seemed to like his meal- However, he sampled mine & would have preferred that! Our colleague had the lobster bisque soup which he enjoyed and the Paccheri Amalfitani.  A downside to the experience. The wait staff wanted to CLEAR our table constantly! We were relaxing, enjoying conversation with our business associate during all the stages of our meals. We were interrupted often by the many bussers that where either trying to grab our plates we hadn't finished, taking plates without asking or asking if we were finished when we clearly weren't?! Our butter was swiped off the table before we even got to taste the complementary bread, had to ask for another.To many employees on staff for how unoccupied the room was. Our waiter was fine; with that said, paying for the atmosphere & fancy flare is another. In our observation  it's extremely pricey for the portions & was not as memorable as we would have wished for.

i was having a thoroughly unimpressive trip to phoenix.  actually my 1st trip to phoenix ever and was starting to feel extremely disillusioned.  i had always heard great things about how fun phoenix was but i guess i must not have been listening very carefully b/c on the way there and while there everyone i spoke to had unkind things to say about the dinning and nightlife.  (turns out tempe and scottsdale are the place to be.)  anyway - excuse my rant. the point is that tomaso's was my one gleaming ray of hope for a decent meal.  i found it on yelp and based on user reviews (w/ the help of gps) i trekked across th 10 E and wah-la! there it was in a nevada bob's strip mall. - ok not impressive but when i strolled in at the off-peak the bartender (Dave) greeted me and promptly set me up at the bar. he doubles as the sommelier and was really helpful in picking out a perfect glass of wine.  the food (linguine w/ clams) was good but not stellar. the linguine was a bit over cooked but it was still better than anything else i'd come across.  the most impressive thing here is how friendly the staff and the patrons were.  it's clear that tomaso (the man, the myth, the legend) has cultivated a good following of locals that come back again and again.  i was surprised to find that he also owns three restaurants in california, a winery and i believe another restaurant in the phoenix area. - you would never know it was such a big operation b/c it still feels small and authentic.
Besides being over-priced, the food wasn't good.  Meal was lukewarm and lacked taste.  Service was good, hence the 2 stars instead of 1.    We won't be back.

Our family dined at Tomaso's last night, Christmas Day. We have dined there and their fabulous restaurant next door, Tommy V's for years and years. We did not have a good experience last night. The four of us were placed at a table for 2. We waited 10-15 minutes before anyone came to offer us water, drinks, bread or a menu. Our waiter was rude. He barely had time to talk about the menu or offer his suggestions. We had to ask for bread and additional drinks. The wrong soup was delivered. When the second bowl arrived it was cold. Our entrees were not hot and the fish did not smell fresh.When our entrees were served, we had to ask if they could remove the 1st course plates. When we finally had to ask for the bill, the waiter shook his head in disgust.  We heard that this was the first year Tomaso's was open on Christmas day. I don't think they were prepared for the volume of business, but I would think the number of reservations would be an indication. They have been in business long enough to know. The owner was hanging in the lobby the entire evening and never looked around at the tables to see if anything was needed. Needless to say, it was NOT a good experience.
Had dinner five fish dinner on black and red pasta outrageously good. Service was excellent food was great   House chianti was great.

This is a classic Italian restaurant landmark in Phoenix.  The atmosphere on the entire experience is romantic... just the way an Italian restaurant should be.   The service was exceptional and I deeply wanted to give this place five stars.   However, there was a blimpish on my last visit and I just can't get over it.  So, I ordered salmon in an Italian restaurant... and I should have ordered pasta or something traditional.   The dish was called Lobster crusted salmon and should have been called salmon with blobs of lobster sauce...  there was nothing crusted about the dish and seemed to be a bust for $32.   Anyway, I'll get over it and I'm sure I'll be back.

Outstanding food and service, Giovanni was our waiter and was phenomenally well versed in the menu and its various options.    The only complaint that my party and I had was the Valet was a little rude and vague about parking, It's definitely easier if you enter the lot from N 32nd St. rather than East Camelback to avoid the loop around the lot to the valet personnel.

Food was excellent. The chef gave a personal tutorial class to my wife and her friends on my wife's birthday. They made her birthday party extra special. The service was phenomenal and everyone at the restaurant went the extra mile to make the food and the service unforgettable!

Went to the new Tomaso's location in North Scottsdale tonight and the service was so bad I walked out . After 20 minutes nobody asked us if we wanted a drink or anything. There were only four tables occupied in the entire restaurant and nobody would wait on us .  Absolutely the worst customer service I have experienced in a restaurant. There are too many good restaurants in North Scottsdale to waste your time on Tomaso's .

We were here last night and I had the "fresh petrale sole and lobster ravioli."  The lobster ravioli was good but the "pan-seared, parmesan-crusted, lemon and butter" petrale sole was overpowered by lemon. I was able to find part of the fish without the "lemon and butter" but it tasted bland and watering. This pricy dish was a disappointment.

Tomaso's is a good, down home, northern italian. They make their own pastas fresh daily, and you can never go wrong there. A friend of mine ordered a steak there once, and claimed it to be the dryest piece of meat they had ever eaten. Meanwhile, I was working on my $28 kobe ravioli, which consisted of 4, count them 4 raviolis... yeah, definitely not gonna cut it. The service is ok, but there are issues now and then with small irrelevent things. They have a very old clientele from the area that I just get the feeling have been frequenting the restaurant for a very long time, and wont dare change what they order. That being said, they don't want anything to change from the menu to the ambiance, to the staff that works there. The whole staff is Italian, and they know how to cook pretty well, but I can't shake that feeling that I'm about 40 years too young to be there, and the portions are just way too small.  +1 for great wine list +1 for homemade pasta -1 for the old people atmosphere.

I am not a big fan of Italian food that's not homemade, but I must say I love the food here. Seafood is always excellent! Also, my family hosted my grad school graduation dinner here for a party of 12 and the service was out of this world!!! They took such good care of us that I will always have fond memories of that night!!! It's not cheap, but the quality is well worth it. Parking is limited, but valet is complimentary.

I cant express my frustration enough. I was so excited to eat fine Italian food but now I'll never try it. As soon as our group walked in we were greeted with dirty looks from the manager and older servers. Yes, we were the youngest people in the entire restaurant. I've never been so clearly judged and belittled. We get seated and wait 20 minutes before deciding to leave after watching tables who arrived after us be greeted by a waiter, presented with a wine list and already had orders taken. Do NOT eat here if you are younger than 50 because the entire service staff will assume you don't have enough money to dine there. We came in there with intentions to spend but apparently our 20 something selves were not welcome. As we left, even the server in our section did not bother to ask what was wrong, he just said have a good night. Well, I hope Tomaso's continues to thrive off the retirement community.

Wow, what a disappointment. My husband and I both work in the service industry and were super excited to FINALLY be able to spend Valentines Day together ON Valentine's Day, instead of having to work. I've told my husband numerous times about how Tomaso's butter squash ravioli brought tears to my eyes because it was sooooo amazing! I haven't been here in several years, so when he surprised me with dinner here for Valentines Day, I was so excited! The issues started when we were seated. We were greeted with water and bread in a timely manner, but everything else seemed to take FOREVER. We sat with the wine menu closed for a good 20 minutes before our server finally came to take our drink order. He walked by us several times in these 20 minutes, so we started to think that either he forgot we were his table, or he assumed we did not have the money to dine here because of our age (mid 20's and early 30's), therefore he simply didn't care to give us good service.  We ordered a couple glasses of wine, the calamari appetizer, the chicken parmigiana, and the nights special, cioppino (which I had to ask our server about because nobody informed us about specials, yet every table around us was ordering it). The calamari was bland and soggy. My husband ordered the chicken parm and was confused when it came out with broccoli and potatoes, when the menu specifically said it came with rigatoni (I even checked the menu on our way out). The sides were lukewarm and he found a hair in his food! I ordered the cioppino and it was boring to say the least. The shrimp were sandy and the mussels had a very STRONG fishy taste, which turned me off to the dish completely. Why didn't we send our food back? Because our server was nowhere to be found during our ENTIRE meal. Not once did he touch the table other than to take our order and bring the check. This was supposed to be a special night for us and was a total letdown. For $130 we expect decent service (at the least) and hot, fresh, hairless food. It's safe to say we will never come here again.

Waited two hours for our meal...no literally two hours. After an hour and 15 minutes, they decided to so generously comp us two drinks, which is exactly what a person needs after starving for two hours, more alcohol. The waiter was very nice and polite and not his fault. After two hours of waiting, we decided to walk out and he chased us out saying he has our food in hand. The restaurant management was aware of the situation and offered me a "glass of wine on the house"...I don't even drink wine and the whole situation was totally absurd. I've been to restaurants where the simplest mistake was made and I got comped an appetizer, drinks AND dessert. These guys did NOTHING right and comped us drinks which we didn't even consume bc we were starving. I will never go here again.

One of the best restaurants in a city with great restaurants, Tomaso's is both a classic in the area and has an ever-changing menu.  Service is exemplary, attentive without being intrusive. Meals are paced well, and whether I have an hour-long dinner or a three-hour dinner, it never feels rushed.  Menu items change regularly, though cult favorites - spaghetti and meatballs, for one, and the sole - are almost always available. A particular joy is the fresh-daily ravioli, which is tremendously wonderful each time.  Off-menu items, both specials and requests, are often available. Our waiter summed it up one time by saying "If we have the parts, we'll make the dish." We've put that to the test a few times, and they always deliver.  A really good wine list, particularly rich in Barolo.  Highly, highly recommend.

Went with my girlfriends for restaurant week. The salmon bruschetta and caprese were very good. But the Sole Picatta was delicious. My friend order lasagna which was made with a bechemel sauce and was very tasty. The lamb osso bucco was fall off the bone yummy

This place has great food!  This place is a staple for a working lunch but I don't know why more people don't come here at night.   I was there mid week around 8 and the place was almost empty. Two friends and I ate at the bar because it was a little too quiet in the dining room. I've been coming here for 10-15 years and the bartenders are always great.   Martinis to start. Big honest.  Caesar. Parmesan bowl. Killer croutons. Anchovies on request. Awesome.   The bartender recommended the lasagna with a side of homemade sausage. Un fn believable! So so so good. Cheesy. Lots of meat sauce. Home made pasta.   I've had almost every main dish and have never been disappointed. The pasta dishes are perfectly al dente and the chicken veal dishes are perfectly cooked with excellent sauces. The service is old school and always excellent.   The decor is a little dated but that's the only negative.

Came here for dinner for Arizona restaurant week. We had a very good dinner. I ordered the stuffed squash blossoms, the roulade of veal and for desert i got the chocolate caramel crunch. The wife got the roasted beet salad, the filet and the tiramisu.   Everything about my meal was very good. Was very surprised at how good the veal was. The desert was a little rich but none the less still delicious.  My wife enjoyed hers as well but neither of us was impressed with the filet, it just didn't seem very tender. But her tiramisu was delicious.  This was our 2nd time eating here and both times have been good experiences.

The food and services were exceptional, fantastic wine list. The large dining room in the back could have better ambience ( i.e. dim the bright lights!) but that is the only small improvement. A great evening and the food could not have been better.

My fiancé took me here again for a date night surprise. Delicioso! Fresh made pasta and exquisite in taste. He had the filet ravioli and I had the pasta platter with a variety of three different raviolis. Everything was cooked to perfection and service was on point with a smile. I can't wait to come back here again and devour their tasty, creamy, flavorful dishes. Yes.. It's on the pricey side.. But worth every bite. We left with our bellies full and happy. Thank you Tomasos for being an Italian staple to Phoenix!

Saturday night I had the pleasure to dine at Tomaso's with some friends. I hadn't been there in years as we live in Chandler and don't often venture that far. It was worth the drive. The restaurant reminds me of old Hollywood- kind of glamorous and classy. The waiters are dressed in crisp white shirts with ties. Our waiter was very Italian and very gracious. Nicely set tables, great ambiance, and great art on the walls. We ordered several different things and please forgive my spelling of some of these dishes. If you look at their menu you'll be able to figure it out. I had the lobster bisque, 2 had the minestrone soup and one had a beautiful salad- all were excellent. The Asso bucco (sp?), eggplant Parmesan and lasagne were all first rate. I had a noodle dish with prosciutto that was fabulous. We had tiramisu and a nonna cake thing that were amazing- especially the tiramisu. A little spendy- probably someplace for celebrations- but great value, service and food.

My wife and went here for our first time on her Birthday and we were not let down. This place had great food, some of the best we have had in  a long time. If you enjoy great food this is the place to go, we will be returning.

Had heard good things about Tomaso's and finally hosted dinner there for out-of-town business clients. Was very impressed when I walked in. The decor was quietly distinguished and gave a warm upscale impression.  Two of us each ordered the Osso Bucco that had been removed from the bone. It was very blah and the pasta it was on was overdone and stuck together like one big clump of dough. How does an Italian restaurant not know how to make good al dente pasta?  Definitely won't be back.

Best Italian restaurant I have visited since moving to the valley. The last visit was on 9/17/2017 at 5PM. Our welcoming server, Erin Patrick, made our party of 5 feel like family. Explained with precise detail how plates were prepared and even offered to modify any selection to our taste. I nearly slipped off my comfortable chair when he stated "if any of you have a favorite Italian dish and you don't see it on the menu just tell me and I will make it for you." All 5 of us had different menu options with each of us so in love with our meal choice we were passing spoonfuls of our meal to another saying "try this-it is so good." May be a bit pricey for pasta meals, however you will not feel taken, but blessed to feel special by being in an old world Italian home for a Sunday family meal at grandma's table. I will be driving from Surprise across the valley to dine here again. Great place for a romantic meal with your special friend where quiet conversation, hand holding, and staring at each other's eyes seem very much appropriate.

Food is good... Service can be slow.  We sat down and it was at least 10-15 minutes before the waiter came over.  Then, we ordered an appetizer (mozzarella tasting board - very good).  After we finished the app, the dirty plates were not taken away despite people coming by or passing the table repeatedly until our dinner showed up.  Disappointed.

Could give zero stars if I could. From the second I walked in there no one acknowledged me and when someone finally did he was extremely rude and dismissing like if i wasn't good enough to be there because I'm Hispanic and everyone in there was white but me. I ordered for pick up and my food was sloppy and disgusting. SO RUDE they should be ashamed of themselves.

This place doesn't live up to its reputation. Food was so so at best. Service was ok but I didn't need the waiters life story. I've heard about it for years , looked forward to going and can't see myself going back.

I was there for a group dinner. I thought it was really strange that they didn't have take-out boxes and we couldn't order a soda. They also didn't ask me how I wanted my steak cooked.  The seafood dinner looked good and the bread was great.  The desserts were a little lackluster, but I think this would be a great place to go for a date night with the husband. But you should be prepared to pay a steep price.

I have never left a review and got this app just to leave one today - this place is TERRIBLE!!! We went there last night for a special night's dinner; my husband had the Alaskan Halibut with Lobster Ravioli and I had the Alaskan Halibut with Blue Crab over Squid Ink Pasta: the halibut was over cooked and dry for both dishes, the blue crab tasted like it was from a can, and the sauce for my dish tasted like it was from a jar. The squid ink pasta was under cooked, less than al dente. They served regular tap water. The server was distracted, inattentive, and never checked to see how we enjoyed the meal. The temperature of the restaurant was too low, myself and other guests were freezing.  Two things that were good: the lobster ravioli were excellent and the manager tried to adjust the temperature. Needless to say, we were more than a little disappointed! We expected more from a restaurant that charges these kinds of prices! Keep your money, go somewhere else, this place isn't worth it!!  We probably should have tried Tarbells in the same strip mall.
Great place to eat! My wife visits a shop just south of them and gets holes drilled in her head there, so we always go to eat at my fav Italian joint after her sessions!
Love the ambiance and the fact that even the waiter speaks Italian.  cant be as authentic as that.

I wanted to take my boyfriend out to a nice Italian restaurant for his birthday rather than doing a steakhouse. I got a recommendation from a coworker to try Tomaso's and I was excited to try a new Italian restaurant that wasn't Olive Garden.  The parking lot was small and we had no choice but to do the complimentary valet.  I'm not a big fan of valeting my car because I've had things stolen from my car before and then I feel obligated to tip.  The atmosphere inside is really nice and cozy and has a romantic feel to it.  The menu items sounded amazing but I was actually pretty disappointed when we got our meal.  Before going out to dinner, I had scoped out the menu online and decided on what I wanted to eat which was the "scampi and risotto".  The description of this dish was "Grilled Giant Prawns with Garlic Scented EVOO; Served with Seafood Medley Risotto" and I was expecting giant prawns and what I got were 4 little prawns with risotto that wasn't cooked all the way and the rice was hard and dry.  I was really disappointed and I really wanted to like the food but it just wasn't what I expected at all, especially for a high priced dish.  The bread and butter they give you before your meal was delicious.  The bread was warm and fresh and the butter was good.  My boyfriend ordered Sea Scallops, Blue Lump Crab, Scampi & Nero di Seppia all'Arrabbiata and he said it was ok but the sauce seemed bland but the seafood seemed to be a generous amount.  The service I will say was exceptional.  They filled our waters and was very attentive.  When I made the reservations to the restaurant, I noted that it was my boyfriends birthday and during dinner, the owner came by and wished him a happy birthday.  When we finished our meal, without even asking the server, the manager and three other servers came with a piece of cake and lit candle and sang him happy birthday.  It was great to see that their service was on point but as far as their food, it's nothing to rave about. I probably won't be back anytime soon.

Very very pricey.  Food was ok. But portions are small. The chicken parmigian was ok, but ridiculously small for $30.  Doesn't even come with pasta. Who serves chicken Park with vegetables. Not sure how you get away with charging those prices but I guess their model is to get them to come once/pay once and not get many returning customers.

We showed up on Dec 30 after hearing so much about this place. Should have gone somewhere else. Ordered the lasagna and stuffed veal chop. Both items were lacking in taste and the veal was flabby. The manager, a very pleasant and professional young lady, immediately came over and offering other items. My wife ordered the salmon and I got the antipasto starter as my meal. Bottom line, will never go back nor do I recommend this restaurant.
